segment.source: Best Practices for the Application Virtualization Sequencer
segment.target: Best Practices for the Application Virtualization Sequencer

segment.source: Best Practices for the Application Virtualization Sequencer
segment.target: Best Practices for the Application Virtualization Sequencer

segment.source: Best Practices for the Application Virtualization Sequencer
segment.target: Best Practices for the Application Virtualization Sequencer

segment.source: This topic provides best practices for running the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.
segment.target: This topic provides best practices for running the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.

segment.source: Review and consider the following recommendations when planning and using the Sequencer in your environment.
segment.target: Review and consider the following recommendations when planning and using the Sequencer in your environment.

segment.source: Sequencing Computer Configuration Best Practices
segment.target: Sequencing Computer Configuration Best Practices

segment.source: The following best practices should be considered when configuring the computer running the App-V Sequencer:
segment.target: The following best practices should be considered when configuring the computer running the App-V Sequencer:

segment.source: Sequence on a computer that has a similar configuration and that is running an earlier version of the operating system than the target computers.
segment.target: Sequence on a computer that has a similar configuration and that is running an earlier version of the operating system than the target computers.

segment.source: Ensure that the computer that is running the Sequencer is running an earlier version of the operating system than the target computers.
segment.target: Ensure that the computer that is running the Sequencer is running an earlier version of the operating system than the target computers.

segment.source: This includes the service pack and update versions.
segment.target: This includes the service pack and update versions.

segment.source: For example, if the target computers are running Windows Vista and Windows XP, you should sequence applications on a computer that is running Windows XP.
segment.target: For example, if the target computers are running Windows Vista and Windows XP, you should sequence applications on a computer that is running Windows XP.

segment.source: The ability to sequence on one operating system and run the virtualized application on a different operating system is not guaranteed, and depends on the particular application and operating system.
segment.target: The ability to sequence on one operating system and run the virtualized application on a different operating system is not guaranteed, and depends on the particular application and operating system.

segment.source: If you encounter issues, you may be required to sequence on the same operating system environment as the one on which the App-V client is running.
segment.target: If you encounter issues, you may be required to sequence on the same operating system environment as the one on which the App-V client is running.

segment.source: Configure the computer running the Sequencer with multiple partitions.
segment.target: Configure the computer running the Sequencer with multiple partitions.

segment.source: You should configure the computer running the Sequencer with at least two primary partitions.
segment.target: You should configure the computer running the Sequencer with at least two primary partitions.

segment.source: The first partition (C:) should contain the operating system, and it should be formatted using the NTFS file system.
segment.target: The first partition (C:) should contain the operating system, and it should be formatted using the NTFS file system.

segment.source: The second partition (Q:) is used as the destination path for the virtual application installation and should also be formatted using the NTFS file system.
segment.target: The second partition (Q:) is used as the destination path for the virtual application installation and should also be formatted using the NTFS file system.

segment.source: Configure the temp directory with enough free disk space.
segment.target: Configure the temp directory with enough free disk space.

segment.source: The Sequencer uses the %TMP% or %TEMP% directory and the Scratch directory to store temporary files during sequencing.
segment.target: The Sequencer uses the %TMP% or %TEMP% directory and the Scratch directory to store temporary files during sequencing.

segment.source: You should configure these directories on the computer running the Sequencer with free disk space equivalent to the estimated application installation requirements.
segment.target: You should configure these directories on the computer running the Sequencer with free disk space equivalent to the estimated application installation requirements.

segment.source: You can verify the location of the Scratch directory by opening the Sequencer console and selecting Tools, Options, and then selecting the Paths tab.
segment.target: You can verify the location of the Scratch directory by opening the Sequencer console and selecting Tools, Options, and then selecting the Paths tab.

segment.source: Configuring the temp directories and the Scratch directory on different hard drive partitions can improve performance during sequencing.
segment.target: Configuring the temp directories and the Scratch directory on different hard drive partitions can improve performance during sequencing.

segment.source: Sequence applications by using Microsoft Virtual PC.
segment.target: Sequence applications by using Microsoft Virtual PC.

segment.source: You will sequence most applications more than once.
segment.target: You will sequence most applications more than once.

segment.source: To help facilitate this, you should consider sequencing on a computer running in a virtual environment.
segment.target: To help facilitate this, you should consider sequencing on a computer running in a virtual environment.

segment.source: This will allow you to sequence an application and revert to a clean state, with minimal reconfiguration, on the computer that is running the Sequencer.
segment.target: This will allow you to sequence an application and revert to a clean state, with minimal reconfiguration, on the computer that is running the Sequencer.

segment.source: If you are running Microsoft Hyper-V in your environment the App-V sequencer will run when the Hyper-V virtual computer it is running on is:
segment.target: If you are running Microsoft Hyper-V in your environment the App-V sequencer will run when the Hyper-V virtual computer it is running on is:

segment.source: paused and resumed.
segment.target: paused and resumed.

segment.source: has its state saved and restored.
segment.target: has its state saved and restored.

segment.source: saved as a snapshot and is restored.
segment.target: saved as a snapshot and is restored.

segment.source: migrated to different hardware as part of a live migration.
segment.target: migrated to different hardware as part of a live migration.

segment.source: Before you sequence a new application, shut down other running programs.
segment.target: Before you sequence a new application, shut down other running programs.

segment.source: Processes and scheduled tasks that normally run on the sequencing computer can slow down the sequencing process and cause irrelevant data to be gathered during sequencing.
segment.target: Processes and scheduled tasks that normally run on the sequencing computer can slow down the sequencing process and cause irrelevant data to be gathered during sequencing.

segment.source: All unnecessary applications and programs should be shut down before you begin sequencing.
segment.target: All unnecessary applications and programs should be shut down before you begin sequencing.

segment.source: Sequence on a computer that is running Terminal Services
segment.target: Sequence on a computer that is running Terminal Services

segment.source: You should not configure the install mode on a computer that is running Terminal Services before you install the sequencer.
segment.target: You should not configure the install mode on a computer that is running Terminal Services before you install the sequencer.

segment.source: Sequencing Best Practices
segment.target: Sequencing Best Practices

segment.source: The following best practices should be considered when sequencing a new application:
segment.target: The following best practices should be considered when sequencing a new application:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are running App-V 4.6 SP1 you do not need to sequence to a directory that follows the 8.3 naming convention.
segment.target: If you are running App-V 4.6 SP1 you do not need to sequence to a directory that follows the 8.3 naming convention.

segment.source: Sequence to a unique directory that follows the 8.3 naming convention.
segment.target: Sequence to a unique directory that follows the 8.3 naming convention.

segment.source: You should sequence all applications to a directory that follows the 8.3 naming convention.
segment.target: You should sequence all applications to a directory that follows the 8.3 naming convention.

segment.source: The specified directory name cannot contain more than eight characters, followed by a three-character file name extension—for example, Q:MYAPP.ABC.
segment.target: The specified directory name cannot contain more than eight characters, followed by a three-character file name extension—for example, Q:MYAPP.ABC.

segment.source: Sequence to a destination folder on the root of the drive, not to a subdirectory.
segment.target: Sequence to a destination folder on the root of the drive, not to a subdirectory.

segment.source: If the application suite has multiple parts, install each application to a subdirectory of the main directory.
segment.target: If the application suite has multiple parts, install each application to a subdirectory of the main directory.

segment.source: For example, if a package contains an application along with a client, use Q:AppSuite as the main directory and sequence the main application to Q:AppSuiteMain, and sequence the client to Q:AppSuiteClient.
segment.target: For example, if a package contains an application along with a client, use Q:AppSuite as the main directory and sequence the main application to Q:AppSuiteMain, and sequence the client to Q:AppSuiteClient.

segment.source: Configure and test the application during the installation phase.
segment.target: Configure and test the application during the installation phase.

segment.source: Completing the installation of an application often requires performing several manual steps that are not part of the application installation process.
segment.target: Completing the installation of an application often requires performing several manual steps that are not part of the application installation process.

segment.source: These steps can involve configuring a connection to a database or copying updated files.
segment.target: These steps can involve configuring a connection to a database or copying updated files.

segment.source: You should perform these configurations during the installation phase and then run the application to make sure it works.
segment.target: You should perform these configurations during the installation phase and then run the application to make sure it works.

segment.source: Run the application, multiple times if necessary, until the program is stable.
segment.target: Run the application, multiple times if necessary, until the program is stable.

segment.source: You should run the application multiple times during the installation to ensure all associated registration and dialog box configurations have been completed.
segment.target: You should run the application multiple times during the installation to ensure all associated registration and dialog box configurations have been completed.

segment.source: Opening the application multiple times during installation will ensure that only the relevant application features are loaded into the primary feature block.
segment.target: Opening the application multiple times during installation will ensure that only the relevant application features are loaded into the primary feature block.

segment.source: Disable all automatic update features associated with the application.
segment.target: Disable all automatic update features associated with the application.

segment.source: Some applications have the ability to check for the latest updates automatically during installation.
segment.target: Some applications have the ability to check for the latest updates automatically during installation.

segment.source: To assist with versioning of virtual application packages, you should disable this feature during sequencing.
segment.target: To assist with versioning of virtual application packages, you should disable this feature during sequencing.

segment.source: If there are required updates, you should sequence a new virtual application package with the associated updates installed.
segment.target: If there are required updates, you should sequence a new virtual application package with the associated updates installed.

segment.target: Related topics
